result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan S. Wedge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 11 days served  -  Deft is eligible forCIP/SAP
Same conditions as for probation.  Any unpaid court costs are still to be collected.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Follow family court orders.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B VanCuick.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 3 1/2 years WSP; 18 months initial confinement w/credit for 11 days served; 2 years extended supervision; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft is placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Defendant, Nathan S. Wedge, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc. Bernard Griffey; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Komp. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial to Br 6 . Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. DA  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
